sn_aia_version.instructions:
use the full_defect_context field from the defects table as input.
Step 1. Run the Keyword Classifier Script Tool 1.1. Scan full_defect_context for matching keywords per group 1.2. Count number of keyword hits per group 1.3. Identify the group with the highest number of keyword matches 1.4. if at least one keyword matches (i.e. bestScore > 0), sets keyword_bucket to that group 1.5. Otherwise, leave keyword_bucket blank Output: keyword_bucket -> best-matching group based on keywords (or ' ' if no match) Step 2. Run AI Classifier (Generic Prompt Tool) 2.1. If keyword bucket was blank, uses GenAI prompt to classify the defect into one of the 8 groups based on the full_context 2.2. Uses the defined prompt with LLM 2.3. LLM returns the best-fitting group Output: prompt_bucket -> group name as suggested by GenAI Step 3: Run Final Resolver (Script Tool) 3.1. Checks which bucket to use as final result 3.2. If the keyword_bucket is not empty uses that, else use the prompt_bucket 3.3. If both are empty, default to "Configuration/Operator Error" Bucket choice. Output: bucket -> final group classification (to be written to record)

sys_update_version.name: sn_aia_version_5507f6f40f4b621016bd69d530d1b2ba

Step 1. Run the Keyword Classifier Script Tool 1.1. Scan full_defect_context for matching keywords per group 1.2. Count number of keyword hits per group 1.3. Identify the group with the highest number of keyword matches 1.4. if at least one keyword matches (i.e. bestScore > 0), sets keyword_bucket to that group 1.5. Otherwise, leave keyword_bucket blank Output: keyword_bucket -> best-matching group based on keywords (or ' ' if no match) Step 2. Run AI Classifier (Generic Prompt Tool) 2.1. If keyword bucket was blank, uses GenAI prompt to classify the defect into one of the 8 groups based on the full_context 2.2. Uses the defined prompt with LLM 2.3. LLM returns the best-fitting group Output: prompt_bucket -> group name as suggested by GenAI Step 3: Run Final Resolver (Script Tool) 3.1. Checks which bucket to use as final result 3.2. If the keyword_bucket is not empty uses that, else use the prompt_bucket 3.3. If both are empty, default to "Configuration/Operator Error" Bucket choice. Output: bucket -> final group classification (to be written to record)</instructions> <state>published</state> <sys_class_name>sn_aia_version</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>alberto.guerra@snc</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2025-07-27 21:13:25</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>global</sys_domain> <sys_id>5507f6f40f4b621016bd69d530d1b2ba</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_name>V1</sys_name> <sys_overrides/> <sys_package display_value="Defect Bucket" source="x_snc_defect_bucke">5dbab1940fc3221016bd69d530d1b24a</sys_package> <sys_policy/> <sys_scope display_value="Defect Bucket">5dbab1940fc3221016bd69d530d1b24a</sys_scope> <sys_update_name>sn_aia_version_5507f6f40f4b621016bd69d530d1b2ba</sys_update_name> <sys_updated_by>alberto.guerra@snc</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2025-07-27 21:13:25</sys_updated_on> <target_id>8da6feb40f4b621016bd69d530d1b26b</target_id> <target_table>sn_aia_agent</target_table> <version_name>V1</version_name> <version_number>1</version_number> </sn_aia_version> </record_update>
